stateCompliance.headline: Understanding California Payday Loan Laws
stateCompliance.intro: Residents of San Jose are protected by California's strict payday loan regulations enforced by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI).
stateCompliance.content: California regulates payday loans under the California Deferred Deposit Transaction Law (CDDTL), administered by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). The state allows payday loans with significant consumer protections: loans are capped at $300 with a maximum fee of 15% (approximately $45). Rollovers are prohibited, meaning lenders cannot issue a new loan to pay off an existing one. California also prohibits lenders from making multiple loans to the same borrower simultaneously. All payday lenders operating in California must be licensed by the DFPI, and consumers can verify a lender's license status online or by calling 1-866-275-2677.
keyPoints: California limits payday loans to a maximum of $300
The maximum fee is 15% of the check amount (up to $45)
Lenders cannot make a new loan to pay off an existing loan (rollovers prohibited)
You cannot have more than one payday loan at a time
If your check bounces, the lender can charge only one NSF fee of up to $15
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment
Your loan contract must be provided in your primary language
All lenders must be licensed - verify at dfpi.ca.gov
protectionsList: Maximum fee: 15% of check face value ($45 maximum)
Criminal prosecution: Cannot be threatened for non-payment
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: IMPORTANT NOTICE: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and does not constitute legal or financial advice. Payday loans are high-cost, short-term loans with APRs that can exceed 400%. Before taking out a payday loan, consider alternatives such as personal loans, credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or assistance from non-profit credit counseling agencies. Laws and regulations may change. For the most current information, contact the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov. If you are experiencing financial difficulties, contact a HUD-approved housing counselor or the National Foundation for Credit Counseling at 1-800-388-2227.
stateCompliance.aprDisclosure: The typical Annual Percentage Rate (APR) for a payday loan in California is approximately 426-460% for a two-week loan. By comparison, credit cards typically have APRs between 15-30% and personal loans between 6-36%. The high APR reflects the short-term nature of payday loans and the fees charged.

testimonials.headline: What Our San Jose Customers Say

reviews.name: Kevin T.
reviews.text: Working in tech, you'd think money wouldn't be an issue, but unexpected expenses happen. The San Jose team was professional and got me the help I needed fast. No judgment, just solutions.

reviews.name: Patricia M.
reviews.text: The downtown San Jose location is easy to find and the staff is wonderful. They explained everything clearly and I was out the door with cash in under 30 minutes.

reviews.name: Jose R.
reviews.text: Needed a short-term loan to cover a repair bill. Ace made the process simple and the terms were fair. Would use them again if needed.

faq.question: Where is your San Jose payday loan location?
faq.answer: Our San Jose branch is located at 150 South First Street, Suite 300, in Downtown San Jose near SoFA District. We are easily accessible from US-101 via Exit 384 (Downtown) and I-280 via Exit 12 (Winchester). Just minutes from the Winchester Mystery House and Tech Interactive Museum.

faq.question: What are your hours in San Jose?
faq.answer: We are open Monday through Friday from 9 AM to 7 PM, and Saturday from 10 AM to 4 PM. We are closed on Sundays. You can also apply online 24/7.

faq.question: How much can I borrow at your San Jose location?
faq.answer: Under California law, payday loans are capped at $300. After the maximum 15% fee ($45), you would receive approximately $255. We also offer installment loans and title loans for larger amounts.

faq.question: Do I need an appointment at the San Jose branch?
faq.answer: No appointment is needed! Walk-ins are welcome during business hours. However, you can save time by starting your application online before visiting our San Jose location.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to your San Jose location?
faq.answer: Please bring a valid government-issued photo ID, proof of income (pay stub or bank statement), an active checking account, and a working phone number. Our friendly staff will guide you through the rest of the process.
